{{cleanup|date=April 2009}} {{pp-vandalism|small=yes}} {{Infobox company | company_name = Kaspersky Lab | company_logo = [[Image:Kaspersky Lab logo.svg|250px|center]] | company_type = [[Privately held company|Private]] | foundation = [[Moscow, Russia]] (1997) | founder = [[Eugene Kaspersky]] | location = [[Moscow]], [[Russian Federation|Russia]] | key_people = [[Eugene Kaspersky]] ([[CEO]])
[[Natalia Kaspersky]] ([[Chairperson]]) | area_served = Worldwide | industry = [[Computer software]]
[[Security software]] | products = [[Kaspersky Anti-Virus]]
[[Kaspersky Internet Security]]
[[Kaspersky Mobile Security]]
[[Kaspersky PURE]]
[[Kaspersky Open Space Security]]
[[Integrated security]] | slogan = | services = | revenue = [[United States dollar|US $]]480 million (2009){{cite web |title=Kaspersky Lab Partner Summit Quarterly Revenue Tops 100 Million|url=http://www.thevarguy.com/2009/02/06/kaspersky-lab-partner-summit-quarterly-revenue-tops-100-million/}} | operating_income = | net_income = [[United States dollar|US $]]67.3 million {{profit}}69% (2006){{cite web |title=Kaspersky Google Hack Takes Spotlight from Russia|url=http://www.pcworld.com/businesscenter/article/188590/kaspersky_google_hack_takes_spotlight_from_russia.html}} | num_employees = over 2,000 (March 2010)[http://www.kaspersky.com/about About Us] | homepage = [http://www.kaspersky.com Kaspersky.com] | footnotes = | intl = yes }} '''Kaspersky Lab''' ({{pron-en|kÃ¦ËspÉrski}}; Russian: ''ÐÐ°Ð±Ð¾ÑÐ°ÑÐ¾ÑÐ¸Ñ ÐÐ°ÑÐ¿ÐµÑÑÐºÐ¾Ð³Ð¾, Laboratoriya Kasperskovo'') is a Russian [[computer security]] company, co-founded by [[Natalia Kaspersky]] and [[Eugene Kaspersky]] in 1997, offering [[antivirus software|anti-virus]], anti-[[spyware]], anti-[[spam (electronic)|spam]], and anti-intrusion products. Kaspersky Lab is a privately held company headquartered in [[Moscow]], [[Russia]] with regional offices in [[India]], [[Germany]], [[France]], the [[Netherlands]], the [[United Kingdom|UK]], [[Poland]], [[Romania]], [[Sweden]], [[Japan]], [[People's Republic of China]], [[South Korea]], and the [[United States|USA]],[http://www.kaspersky.com/about About Us]. In 2008, IDC ranked Kaspersky Lab as the fourth-largest global antivirus vendor.[http://www.kaspersky.com/news?id=207575957 Kaspersky Lab named among Top 4 vendors of security solutions for endpoint users]. Kaspersky.com (2009-11-09). Retrieved on 2010-09-29. Kaspersky Lab was also included in Software Top 100âs 2009 edition of the worldâs software company rankings. Kaspersky Lab was listed 76th on the list,[http://www.softwaretop100.org/software-top-100/global-software-top-100-edition-2009 Global Software Top 100 - Edition 2009 - The World's Largest Software Companies]. Software Top 100 (2009-11-10). Retrieved on 2010-09-29. and became the first Russian software company to be included on the list. The Kaspersky Anti-Virus engine also powers products or solutions by other security vendors, such as [[Check Point]], [[Blue Coat Systems|Bluecoat]], [[Juniper Networks]], [[Sybari]] (now acquired by [[Microsoft]]), Netintelligence, [[GFI Software]], [[F-Secure]], [[Clearswift]], [[FrontBridge]], G-Data, [[Netasq]], and others. Altogether, more than 120 companies are licensing technology from Kaspersky. Kaspersky Labs currently has [[Jackie Chan]] as their product spokesman.[http://www.kasperskyasia.com/news_20090416_01.html Kaspersky Lab invites you to join Jackie Chan and friendsâ concert at âBirdâs Nestâ, Beijing National Stadium][http://gizmodo.com/5324651/what-the-hell-did-jackie-chan-just-make-me-watch Gizmodo.com - What the Hell Did Jackie Chan Just Make Me Watch?] == Products == {{seealso|Kaspersky Anti-Virus|Kaspersky Internet Security|Kaspersky Mobile Security}} [[Image:Kaspersky Internet Security.png|200px|thumb|right|Kaspersky Internet Security 2011]] The current line of Kaspersky home-user products consists of [[Kaspersky Internet Security]] (KIS) 2011, [[Kaspersky Anti-Virus]] (KAV) 2011, [[Kaspersky Mobile Security]] (KMS) and AVZ Antiviral Toolkit, [[Kaspersky Anti-Virus for Mac]], [[Kaspersky Password Manager]], [[Kaspersky KryptoStorage]].[http://usa.kaspersky.com/products_services/ Products & Services | Kaspersky Lab United States]. Usa.kaspersky.com. Retrieved on 2010-09-29. In 2010, Kaspersky launched a consumer security suite named Kaspersky Pure. Kaspersky products are widely used throughout Europe and Asia. In the United States, Kaspersky Lab was ranked as the fastest growing internet security software,NPD Group/Retail Tracking/Security Software July 2006-June 2009 based on NPD sales data. In addition to the companyâs consumer products, Kaspersky Lab offers a variety of security applications designed for small business, corporations and large enterprises. These offerings include security software to protect workstations, file servers, mail servers, mobile devices, and Internet gateways,[http://usa.kaspersky.com/products_services/business/security_apps.php Business Security | Kaspersky Lab United States]. Usa.kaspersky.com. Retrieved on 2010-09-29. all managed through a centralized Administration Kit. These applications are also available in bundled security suites,[http://usa.kaspersky.com/products_services/business/open_space.php Business Security | Kaspersky Lab United States]. Usa.kaspersky.com. Retrieved on 2010-09-29. scaled to fit the requirements of organizations of varying sizes. Kaspersky Lab products are available via retail stores such as Best-Buy, PC-World, Currys and online through the official Kaspersky eStore or [[Amazon.com]] and other retailers. The latest 2009 line of Kaspersky products are certified for [[Windows Vista]] and are [[multi-core]] optimized.{{cite web |publisher= Kaspersky Lab |url=http://support.kaspersky.com/kis2009/cert |title=Kaspersky Internet Security 2009 Certifications }} == Independent assessments == The anti-virus software testing group AV-Comparatives gave the Windows XP version of Kaspersky AV an "Advanced+" rating (its highest) in both its February 2008 on-demand detection test (with the fourth highest detection rate among 16 products tested).[http://www.av-comparatives.org/seiten/ergebnisse_2008_02.php Anti-Virus comparative February 2008] However, in the Retrospective/Proactive Test May 2008, Kaspersky received the "Standard" rating, detecting 21% of new malware with 1-month old signatures and receiving a substantial amount of false positives. [http://www.av-comparatives.org/seiten/ergebnisse_2008_05.php Retrospective / ProActive - Test May 2008] The firewall included in Kaspersky Internet Security 7.0 got a "Very Good" rating in Matousec's Firewall challenge,[http://www.matousec.com/projects/firewall-challenge/results.php Results and comments - matousec.com] with a result of 85%. Kaspersky Anti-Virus 7.0 has achieved a 6.5 result out of 8 in the Anti Malware Labs rootkit detection test.[http://www.anti-malware-test.com/?q=taxonomy/term/7 Anti-rootkit tests | Anti-Malware Test Lab] It has also achieved a 31 out of 33 detection of polymorphic viruses[http://www.anti-malware-test.com/?q=taxonomy/term/5 Anti-Malware Solutions Test Results | Anti-Malware Test Lab] and a 97% result in the self-protection test.[http://www.anti-malware-test.com/?q=taxonomy/term/16 Self-protection test | Anti-Malware Test Lab] In 2007 Kaspersky Internet Security 7 received an award from the British magazine ''[[PC Pro]]'' and also won a place in its "A List".{{cite news |url=http://www.kaspersky.co.uk/news?id=207575604 |title=Kaspersky Internet Security 7.0 receives two top awards in testing conducted by the British magazine PC Pro |publisher=Kaspersky Labs |date=2007-04-05}} In addition, Kaspersky has almost passed all [[Virus Bulletin]] comparative tests since August 2003 (failed: June 7, Dec 07 and June 8[http://www.virusbtn.com/vb100/archive/results?vendor=VE15 VB100 Results Overview: Kaspersky]). According to ''[[PC World (magazine)|PC World]]'' magazine, Kaspersky anti-virus software provides the fastest updates for new virus and security threats in the industry.{{cite news |url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/id,124493-page,1/article.html |title=Anti-Virus Personal 5.0 (Full Product) |publisher=PC World Magazine |date=2005-01-25 |accessdate=2007-02-02}} In the latest{{When|date=March 2009}} AV-Comparatives test{{Fact|date=March 2009}}, the Technical Release build of Kaspersky 2009 achieved a nearly 85% proactive detection rate, when including both [[heuristic analysis]] and [[Intrusion Prevention System#Host-based|HIPS]]. In ''PC World'' magazineâs March 2010 comparison of consumer security suites, Kaspersky Internet Security 2010 scored 4.5/5 stars, and was rated second overall.[http://www.pcworld.com/reviews/product/413778/review/internet_security_2010.html Kaspersky Lab Internet Security 2010 Antivirus & Security Software Review]. PCWorld (2010-03-30). Retrieved on 2010-09-29. Kaspersky has also received certification of their products through the [[OESIS OK]] Certification Program, which verifies that the applications are interoperable with third-party technology solutions like [[Network Access Control|NAC]] and [[VPN|SSL VPN]] products from [[Cisco Systems]], [[Juniper Networks]], [[F5 Networks]], and others.[http://www.kaspersky.com/news?id=207575876 New versions of Kaspersky Lab's personal products]. Kaspersky.com (2009-07-31). Retrieved on 2010-09-29. == Litigation == In May 2007, [[adware]] distributor [[Zango (company)|Zango]] filed a lawsuit against Kaspersky Lab, accusing it of trade libel for blocking the installation of Zango software. In August, the court ruled that the [[Communications Decency Act]] granted immunity to Kaspersky.{{cite web |publisher= ars technica |url= http://arstechnica.com/news.ars/post/20070830-zango-tries-fails-to-sue-its-way-out-from-under-the-spyware-label.html |title= Zango tries, fails to sue its way out from under the "spyware" label |date= August 30, 2007 |accessdate= 2007-09-05}} == See also == * [[Securelist.com]] == References == {{Reflist|2}} == External links == {{Commonscat|Kaspersky Lab}} {{Portal box|Companies|Computer security}} * {{Official|http://www.kaspersky.com}} * [http://www.kasperskyclub.com Official Fanclub website] * [http://rbth.ru/articles/2010/04/29/the_virus_warrior_a_start_up_tale.html The Virus Warrior: A Start-Up Tale] By Jessica Bachman, Ernst & Young, April 29, 2010.
